property.name: profiler_kafka_start
property.description: One of EARLIEST, LATEST, UNCOMMITTED_EARLIEST, UNCOMMITTED_LATEST

property.name: profiler_period_duration
property.description: The duration of each profile period. This value should be defined along with profiler.period.duration.units

property.name: profiler_period_units
property.description: The units used to specify the profiler.period.duration. This value should be defined along with profiler.period.duration.

property.name: profiler_window_duration
property.description: The duration of each profile window. This value should be defined along with profiler.window.duration.units

property.name: profiler_window_units
property.description: The units used to specify the profiler.window.duration. This value should be defined along with profiler.window.duration.

property.name: profiler_ttl
property.description: If a message has not been applied to a Profile in this period of time, the Profile will be terminated and its resources will be cleaned up. This value should be defined along with profiler.ttl.units. This time-to-live does not affect the persisted Profile data in HBase. It only affects the state stored in memory during the execution of the latest profile period. This state will be deleted if the time-to-live is exceeded.

property.name: profiler_ttl_units
property.description: The units used to specify the profiler.ttl.

property.name: profiler_window_lag
property.description: The maximum time lag for timestamps. Timestamps cannot arrive out-of-order by more than this amount.

property.name: profiler_window_lag_units
property.description: The units used to specify the Event Time Lag.

property.name: profiler_topology_message_timeout_secs
property.description: The maximum amount of time a message has to complete before it is considered failed.

property.name: profiler_topology_max_spout_pending
property.description: Profiler Topology Spout Max Pending Tuples

property.name: profiler_max_routes_per_bolt
property.description: The max number of routes allowed per bolt. The number of routes increases as the number of profiles and entities increases.

property.name: profiler_hbase_table
property.description: The name of the HBase table that profile data is written to. The Profiler expects that the table exists and is writable.

property.name: profiler_hbase_cf
property.description: The column family used to store profile data in HBase.

property.name: profiler_hbase_batch
property.description: The number of puts that are written to HBase in a single batch.

property.name: profiler_hbase_flush_interval
property.description: The maximum number of seconds between batch writes to HBase.

property.name: profiler_topology_worker_childopts
property.description: Extra topology child opts for the storm topology.

property.name: profiler_topology_workers
property.description: The profiler storm topology workers

property.name: profiler_acker_executors
property.description: The profiler storm topology acker executors

property.name: profiler_kafka_writer_batch_size
property.description: The number of records to batch when writing to Kakfa.

property.name: profiler_kafka_writer_batch_timeout
property.description: The timeout in milliseconds after which a batch will be written to Kafka, even if the batch size has not been met. If unspecified, or set to `0`, this defaults to a system-determined duration.
